page.title: 19Education around Raveley
page.content: There are no schools within the three villages of Great and Little Raveley and Wistow, although Wistow does have a small preschool playgroup for the under fives. Children of primary school age, 4+ to ll, are collected daily by bus and taken to Upwood County Primary School. Secondary school children are also collected by bus and taken to Ailwyn School, Ramsey, where they remain until the age of l3+, when they are transferred to the adjacent Abbey School. Here they can either leave at l6 or continue their education by taking CSE's and 'O' level and 'A' level examinations. Students are able to further their education at Huntingdon Technical College, 6 miles away. Adult education facilities are provided at Ailwyn School, Ramsey and at Huntingdon Technical College.
